Device.Name: STM32G47x/G48x/G414
Device.Description: Category 3 devices, ARM 32-bit Cortex-M4 based device

Peripheral.Name: Embedded Flash
Peripheral.Description: The Flash memory interface manages CPU AHB I-Code and D-Code accesses to the Flash memory. It implements the erase and program Flash memory operations and the read and write protection mechanisms

Peripheral.Name: OTP
Peripheral.Description: The Data OTP memory block. It contains the one time programmable bits.

Peripheral.Name: MirrorOptionBytes
Peripheral.Description: Mirror Option Bytes contains the extra area.

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
or any value other than 0xAA and 0xCC: Level 1, read protection
Level 2, no debug

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset. They can be written to program a new BOR level value into Flash memory

Values.Val: BOR Level 0, reset level threshold is around 1.7 V
BOR Level 1, reset level threshold is around 2.0 V
BOR Level 2, reset level threshold is around 2.2 V
BOR Level 3, reset level threshold is around 2.5 V
BOR Level 4, reset level threshold is around 2.8 V
Reset generated when entering Stop mode
No reset generated when entering Stop mode
Reset generated when entering Standby mode
No reset generated when entering Standby mode
Reset generated when entering the Shutdown mode
No reset generated when entering the Shutdown mode
Hardware independent watchdog
Software independent watchdog
Freeze IWDG counter in stop mode
IWDG counter active in stop mode
Freeze IWDG counter in standby mode
IWDG counter active in standby mode
Hardware window watchdog
Software window watchdog
Dual-bank boot disable
Dual-bank boot enable
Single bank mode with 128 bits data read width
Dual bank mode with 64 bits data
Boot from Flash if BOOT0 = 0, otherwise Embedded SRAM1
Boot from Flash if BOOT0 = 0, otherwise system memory

Bit.Name: SRAM_PE
Bit.Description: SRAM1 and CCM SRAM parity check enable

Values.Val: SRAM1 and CCM SRAM parity check enable
SRAM1 and CCM SRAM parity check disable

Bit.Name: CCMSRAM_RST
Bit.Description: CCM SRAM Erase when system reset

Values.Val: CCM SRAM erased when a system reset occurs
CCM SRAM is not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: nSWBOOT0
Bit.Description: Software BOOT0

Values.Val: BOOT0 taken from the option bit nBOOT0
BOOT0 taken from PB8/BOOT0 pin

Bit.Name: nBOOT0
Bit.Description: This option bit sets the BOOT0 value only when nSWBOOT0=0

Values.Val: nBOOT0 = 0
nBOOT0 = 1
Reserved
Reset Input only: a low level on the NRST pin generates system reset, internal RESET not propagated to the NSRT pin
GPIO: standard GPIO pad functionality, only internal RESET possible
Bidirectional reset: NRST pin configured in reset input/output mode (legacy mode)

Bit.Name: IRHEN
Bit.Description: Internal reset holder enable bit

Values.Val: Internal resets are propagated as simple pulse on NRST pin
Internal resets drives NRST pin low until it is seen as low level

Bit.Name: PCROP1_STRT
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PCROP1_STRT
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PCROP1_END
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP End address(excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling PCROP_RDP and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0

Bit.Name: PCROP1_END
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP End address(excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling PCROP_RDP and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0

Values.Val: PCROP area is not erased when the RDP level is decreased from Level 1 to Level 0
PCROP area is erased when the RDP level is decreased from Level 1 to Level 0 (full mass erase)

Bit.Name: WRP1A_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of the first page of the Bank 1 WRP first area

Bit.Name: WRP1A_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of the first page of the Bank 1 WRP first area

Bit.Name: WRP1A_END
Bit.Description: The address of the last page of the Bank 1 WRP first area

Bit.Name: WRP1A_END
Bit.Description: The address of the last page of the Bank 1 WRP first area

Bit.Name: WRP1B_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of the first page of the Bank 1 WRP second area

Bit.Name: WRP1B_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of the first page of the Bank 1 WRP second area

Bit.Name: WRP1B_END
Bit.Description: The address of the last page of the Bank 1 WRP second area

Bit.Name: WRP1B_END
Bit.Description: The address of the last page of the Bank 1 WRP second area

Bit.Name: PCROP2_STRT
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PCROP2_STRT
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PCROP2_END
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 PCROP End address(excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling PCROP_RDP and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0

Bit.Name: PCROP2_END
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 PCROP End address(excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling PCROP_RDP and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0

Bit.Name: WRP2A_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of first page of the Bank 2 WRP first area

Bit.Name: WRP2A_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of first page of the Bank 2 WRP first area

Bit.Name: WRP2A_END
Bit.Description: The address of last page of the Bank 2 WRP first area

Bit.Name: WRP2A_END
Bit.Description: The address of last page of the Bank 2 WRP first area

Bit.Name: WRP2B_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of first page of the Bank 2 WRP second area

Bit.Name: WRP2B_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of first page of the Bank 2 WRP second area

Bit.Name: WRP2B_END
Bit.Description: The address of last page of the Bank 2 WRP second area

Bit.Name: WRP2B_END
Bit.Description: The address of last page of the Bank 2 WRP second area

Bit.Name: SEC_SIZE1
Bit.Description: sets the number of pages used in the bank 1 securable area

Bit.Name: BOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: Unique boot entry point

Values.Val: Boot based on the pad/option bit configuration
Boot will be done from user flash only, whatever the RDP level

Bit.Name: SEC_SIZE2
Bit.Description: sets the number of pages used in the bank 2 securable area

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
or any value other than 0xAA and 0xCC: Level 1, read protection
Level 2, no debug

BOR Level 1, reset level threshold is around 2.0 V
BOR Level 2, reset level threshold is around 2.2 V
BOR Level 3, reset level threshold is around 2.5 V
BOR Level 4, reset level threshold is around 2.8 V
Freeze IWDG counter in stop mode
IWDG counter active in stop mode
Freeze IWDG counter in standby mode
IWDG counter active in standby mode

Software window watchdog
Hardware independent watchdog
Software independent watchdog
Reset generated when entering Stop mode
No reset generated
Reset generated when entering Standby mode
No reset generated
Reset generated when entering the Shutdown mode
No reset generated when entering the Shutdown mode

Dual-bank boot enable
Single bank mode with 128 bits data read width
Dual bank mode with 64 bits data
Boot from Flash if BOOT0 = 0, otherwise Embedded SRAM1
Boot from Flash if BOOT0 = 0, otherwise system memory
